Title: Snam delays commercial operation start of Ravenna FSRU to May
Description: Italian utility Snam said that the commissioning of its BW Singapore floating storage regasification unit (FSRU) deployed at Ravenna LNG is “in full swing”, with the first phase of commercial operations expected in early May.
Author: JS

Title: Gulf to develop Thailand’s third LNG import terminal
Description:
Gulf MTP LNG Terminal Company Limited (GMTP) has entered into a 35-year Public Private Partnership (PPP) contract with the Industrial Estate Authority of Thailand (IEAT) to develop the Eastern Economic Corridor, which includes the construction of a 5 mtpa LNG import terminal in Map Ta Phut.

GMT is a joint venture between Gulf Development Public Company, which holds a 70% stake, and PTT Tank Terminal Company, which holds the remaining 30%.
Author: JS

Title: Aramco solidifies deal to offtake 1.2 mtpa from NextDecade’s Rio Grande LNG Train 4
Description: Saudi Aramco and NextDecade have executed a sales and purchase agreement under which Aramco will offtake 1.2 mtpa of LNG from Train 4 of the proposed Rio Grande LNG export plant in Texas for a period of 20 years.
Author: JS

Title: Japan weighs Alaska LNG investment amid escalating US tariffs
Description: Japan, the world's second-largest LNG importer, is exploring investment opportunities in the proposed 20 mtpa Alaska LNG project in Nikiski as part of a broader strategy to address escalating trade tensions with the United States.
Author: CK

Title: Enarsa seeks eight more LNG cargoes for Escobar, delivery in June and July
Description: Argentina’s state-owned energy firm Energia Argentina, or Enarsa, has issued its second tender for the year seeking eight more LNG cargoes for delivery to the 6.1 mtpa Escobar LNG receiving terminal to meet the country’s demand this winter. The tender closes on Apr. 14.
Author: CK

Title: Snam acquires stake in Vier Gas Holding, gains indirect access to German transmission firm OGE
Description: Italian gas infrastructure firm Snam has agreed to acquire a 24.99% stake in Luxembourg-based Vier Gas Holding, based in Luxembourg, from Abu Dhabi’s Infinity Investments, gaining indirect access to Open Grid Europe, Germany’s largest independent gas transmission operator. This acquisition provides Snam with a foothold in the German gas market and expands its presence along key European energy corridors.
Author: CK

Title: Philippines’ First Gen receives first Qatari LNG cargo at Batangas terminal
Description: Philippines’ utility First Gen has received the first LNG cargo from Qatar at its 5.3 mtpa FGEN Batangas LNG terminal in Luzon, marking a new source of supply for the facility.
Author: CK
